skill.name: Playwright Browser Automation
skill.description: Complete browser automation with Playwright. Auto-detects dev servers, writes clean test scripts to /tmp. Test pages, fill forms, take screenshots, check responsive design, validate UX, test login flows, check links, automate any browser task. Use when user wants to test websites, automate browser interactions, validate web functionality, or perform any browser-based testing.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate browser automation skill using Playwright. It writes test scripts to /tmp and executes them via Node.js to perform web testing, screenshot capture, form interaction, and accessibility audits. All functionality aligns with stated purpose.

low_findings.title: Script execution via Node.js
low_findings.description: The skill writes JavaScript files to /tmp and executes them with Node.js. This is standard behavior for a browser automation tool. Scripts are executed only when explicitly requested by the user. Lines 76-77 show: 'node run.js /tmp/playwright-test-{name}.js'

low_findings.title: Network requests for browser automation
low_findings.description: The skill makes HTTP requests to check links and navigate to web pages. Lines 203-212 show HTTP HEAD requests to validate links: 'await page.request.head(href)'

low_findings.title: Filesystem writes to /tmp
low_findings.description: The skill writes test scripts and screenshots to /tmp directory. Lines 41 and 62 document writing scripts and screenshots: 'NEVER write test files to plugin directory. Always use /tmp/playwright-test-*.js'

content.value_statement: Test websites and automate browser interactions. Write custom Playwright scripts to test pages, fill forms, take screenshots, and validate responsive design across devices.
actual_capabilities: Write and execute Playwright test scripts in /tmp directory
Take screenshots of pages and specific elements
Fill forms and test login flows automatically
Check for broken links on any webpage
Test responsive design across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports
Run accessibility audits using axe-core and measure performance metrics
limitations: Requires Playwright and Chromium browser installation via npm run setup
Cannot test websites that block automated browser access
Limited to browser-based interactions only, no backend API testing

use_cases.title: Test local development
use_cases.description: Test local websites by auto-detecting dev servers and running automated browser tests

use_cases.title: Validate web forms
use_cases.description: Automate form filling, submission testing, and login flow validation across browsers

use_cases.title: Check responsive design
use_cases.description: Capture screenshots across multiple viewports to verify responsive design implementation

prompt_templates.title: Take a screenshot

prompt_templates.prompt: Check all links on https://example.com and report which ones are broken

prompt_templates.title: Test form
prompt_templates.prompt: Test the contact form on https://example.com by filling in name, email, and message fields

prompt_templates.title: Responsive test
prompt_templates.prompt: Test https://example.com across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports and save screenshots

best_practices: Use /tmp for all test scripts to keep the plugin directory clean
Set headless: false to see browser actions as they happen
Always detect dev servers first when testing localhost applications
anti_patterns: Writing test files to the plugin installation directory
Using headless mode when you need to see what is happening
Skipping error handling in automation scripts

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows with Node.js installed. Requires npm to install Playwright dependencies.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits. Performance depends on system resources and browser instance management. Close browsers when done.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts can run in CI environments with headless: true for automated testing pipelines.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All scripts and screenshots are written to /tmp directory only. No data is sent to external servers by the skill.

faq.question: Why is browser not opening?
faq.answer: Ensure display is available for headless: false mode. Use headless: true for headless environments or set up virtual display.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill writes custom Playwright scripts on demand. It works with any website and provides more flexibility than record-playback tools.
